timeline.message: app-insights track event for callbacks with thread local and custom event
RDM-8787 - unit tests for track event
RDM-8787 - unit tests for track event

timeline.bodyText: shouldn't this be initialized at L 117?
timeline.author: MSancaktutar

replies.bodyText: i think just before http call is better otherwise it counts s2s token time as well. (L124)
replies.author: smathangi

replies.bodyText:
What if S2S token generation itself fails? finally block will use a null startTime.
How about doing all time consuming activity on top of the method and after that initialising the startTime?
replies.author: MSancaktutar

replies.bodyText: Yeah.. good point. Lets move s2s bit on top of the method.
replies.author: smathangi

timeline.author: MSancaktutar
MSancaktutar
MSancaktutar

timeline.bodyText: better putting this on top of the method.
timeline.author: MSancaktutar

replies.bodyText: i guess just before callback http call is better. I don't want to populate context if s2s call is failed.
replies.author: smathangi

replies.bodyText: moving to the top of the method all computation that takes time and has potential to fail seems to be the best approach, then, doesn't it?
replies.author: MSancaktutar

timeline.bodyText: can we add a Javadoc explaining the usage of this class
timeline.author: mario-paniccia

timeline.bodyText: can we add a Javadoc explaining the usage of this class
timeline.author: mario-paniccia

replies.bodyText: Maybe let's call it CallbackTelemetryThreadContext so that in the future we can use it for other type of Azure dependency calls as well?
replies.author: mario-paniccia

timeline.bodyText: Maybe let's call it TelemetryContext so that in the future we can use it for other types of Azure dependency calls as well?
timeline.author: mario-paniccia

replies.bodyText: I would prefer separate object for each specific purpose. We can always revisit structure/relationship when more use cases come in..
replies.author: smathangi

timeline.author: mario-paniccia

timeline.bodyText: with this solution we assume if a telemetry context exists then the dependency is a callback. We could make this a bit more generic and reusable for non-callback dependencies by marking as callback if getCallbackType() is not blank?
timeline.author: mario-paniccia
